author: D. Honey
comment: This entire platform is inconsistent. Some days it works great, other days you won't even get push notifications to the watch from any app whatsoever. It can, in theory, function as a media remote (sometimes), but that's only with Spotify and only when the app chooses to function. The Play Music app just wants to attach to Wi-Fi thus defeating any usefulness it has to control the actual device its paired with.  In short, get an iPhone and get an Apple Watch if you want a hands free life with a wearable.

author: Nick Waller
comment: STILL NO FIX for the messaging bug, when I have this app installed notifications pop for half a second then disappear. So then I have no idea that I've received messages. This has been an issue for several updates, and this review gets buried as old. This is still an issue, I have to delete this app every time I plan to go without my watch. Making me use my watch less than I'd like.

author: RiCo
comment: 98% happy with this app, except for the "always on" media notifications on the watch.    When I'm playing music on my phone (which is most of the time) my watch lights up and displays media controls and stays on until I notice it and dismiss it.  This really eats through my precious battery life.

It has been more than 3 years I had this watch. Today it dies out. Good times. Will I buy another android wear? No. Got too much devices to charge. Back to old reliable edifice. 3 years and still running out of the box. My 2015 moto 360 had a good run 👍

author: Robert Hooker
comment: Android Messages no longer sends notifications to my watch. All other notifications come through fine. Have gone as far as full resets of phone and watch. It then worked for a bit until it updated. Now it is broken again. I have a Nexus 6p and Huawei Smart watch.

reply.author: Google LLC
reply.content: Hi Robert. To resolve the notification problems, please follow these steps: https://goo.gl/KPuRuL. If these steps don't work, please get in touch with the manufacturer directly (if outside the US) or here: https://goo.gl/uaUiIq. Thanks for reaching out.

author: Laura West
comment: My phone recognizes and connects to my watch after this app updated. This app doesn't do either. Phone bluetooth says smartwatch connected- this app doesn't even see it. Their resolution? Reset the phone to factory settings! *insert swearword here* NOT HAPPY

author: Ryan Morency
comment: After the latest update, my ZenWatch3 started dropping its Bluetooth connection to my V20. Went to factory reset (as that is Google's usual "solution") and now I can't even get it to connect at all. Once again, Google has screwed up my watch.

reply.author: Google LLC
reply.content: Hi Ryan. Please try the steps here: https://goo.gl/glwiQ5. If these steps don't work, please get in touch with the manufacturer directly (if outside the US) or here: https://goo.gl/uaUiIq. Thanks for reaching out.

author: Parth Bhadoriya
comment: I don't know what's wrong with the app. I own a fossil q explorist and I am unable to get black (darker background). Everything is updated.

author: Laurence Gough
comment: it would be better if you could change what happens when you swipe left and right from your home screen, why on earth would you want to change your watch face that often. It would be better if the user could reassign these vital UI elements. The voice to text isn't perfect as it doesn't let you correct words, or sometimes it will hear the word fine but then change it to one totally out of context. Oh and it's impossible to set the Google assistant language to anything other than US as it just changes back every time. Thanks.

author: MrJCena
comment: Terrible updates, it's been the same issues for months, just loses connections as if it doesn't even have Bluetooth and causes conflicts constantly with WiFi. Update: They just released Android 8.0 Oreo for my LG Style and as far as I can tell, after 3 days of use I haven't had a single issue. There isn't much of a difference with the os appearance, but apparently they fixed whatever horrible bug plagued these devices. I'll give it more stars as I text it and Android continues to update.

author: Simon Hoang
comment: Edit: every thing seems to be working fine now.   Previous: This was great up until the 2.9 update. I no longer receive any notifications on my watch.

author: David Clarkson
comment: After one of the last 3 updates or so, it really consumes a lot of my watch battery. It used to consume maybe 1%. Now it is 4 - 8%.  (Why is this review showing up for an older version when I am on the most current version?)

reply.author: Google LLC
reply.content: Hi David. Try these steps to resolve the battery drain: https://goo.gl/J1nOFH. If these steps don't work, please get in touch with the manufacturer directly (if outside the US) or here: https://goo.gl/uaUiIq. Thanks for reaching out.

author: Daniel Combs
comment: After the last Android update for my Galaxy S6, combined with the latest Android Wear update, the SMS notification issue finally sems to be resolved after several months of frustration !! All 3 of my watches seem to be functioning perfectly.  Thank you for replying to my review.

reply.author: Google LLC
reply.content: Hi Daniel. To resolve the notification problems, please follow these steps: https://goo.gl/KPuRuL. If these steps don't work, please get in touch with the manufacturer directly (if outside the US) or here: https://goo.gl/uaUiIq. Thanks for reaching out.

author: Vladimir Premeru
comment: Edit March 5th: Thank you, Google, for responding. I have tried a dozen potential workarounds an fixes including the one you offered. This issue is not manufacturer related, please check other people's comments on the net (literally thousands are having the same issue). It is due to the fact tha Android Wear app is not holding the bluetooth internet sharing service or something for the watch. When restarted, it works for a while. Please, solve it, you are the smartest people. Thanks Connectivity is a serious issue. As thousands of other people, I have a problem with bluetooth internet sharing (for Android Wear smartwatch) disconnecting without reason. It's a shame that Google's app should underperform like this and that no reaction or suggestion how to solve this problem has been given by Google.

reply.author: Google LLC
reply.content: Hi Vladimir. Please try the steps here: goo.gl/8RZAsW. If these steps don't work, please get in touch with the manufacturer directly (if outside the US) or here: https://goo.gl/uaUiIq. Thanks for reaching out.

author: WILLIAM BAIN
comment: Harsh battery impact, constant disconnections. Battery on both phone and watch have quartered. Not impressed. But hey! Possible updates in several months or so... Update of 27/02/18 Now the watch doesn't even receive notifications. Google might as well give up.
